ingredients.name: AQUA
ingredients.description: Water, the most common cosmetic ingredient. Used as a solvent.

ingredients.name: WATER
ingredients.description: Water, the most common cosmetic ingredient. Used as a solvent.

ingredients.name: GLYCERIN
ingredients.description: A humectant that draws moisture into the skin. Generally considered very safe.

ingredients.name: HYALURONIC ACID
ingredients.description: A powerful humectant that hydrates the skin. Safe and effective.

ingredients.name: NIACINAMIDE
ingredients.description: A form of Vitamin B3 with multiple skin benefits. Well-tolerated and safe.

ingredients.name: TOCOPHEROL
ingredients.description: Vitamin E, an antioxidant that protects the skin from free radical damage.

ingredients.name: BUTYROSPERMUM PARKII BUTTER
ingredients.description: Shea Butter. A rich emollient that moisturizes and soothes the skin.

ingredients.name: CETEARYL ALCOHOL
ingredients.description: A fatty alcohol used as an emollient and thickener. Not to be confused with drying alcohols. Generally safe.

ingredients.name: CAPRYLIC/CAPRIC TRIGLYCERIDE
ingredients.description: An emollient derived from coconut oil and glycerin. Considered safe and non-sensitizing.

ingredients.name: FRAGRANCE
ingredients.description: A generic term for a mix of scent chemicals and ingredients that can include allergens, sensitizers, and potential hormone disruptors. Lack of transparency is a major concern.

ingredients.name: PARFUM
ingredients.description: Synonym for Fragrance. A complex mixture of scent chemicals which may contain allergens and irritants not listed on the label.

ingredients.name: C14-22 ALCOHOLS
ingredients.description: A mix of fatty alcohols. Generally low risk, but can be comedogenic for some skin types.

ingredients.name: Cocamidopropyl Betaine
ingredients.description: A surfactant that can cause irritation or allergic reactions in sensitive individuals.

ingredients.name: Decyl Glucoside
ingredients.description: A gentle, plant-derived surfactant ideal for sensitive skin.

ingredients.name: Sodium Cocoyl Isethionate
ingredients.description: A mild, coconut-derived surfactant used in sulfate-free cleansers.

ingredients.name: Stearic Acid
ingredients.description: A fatty acid used as a thickener and emulsifier. Generally safe.

ingredients.name: Cetyl Alcohol
ingredients.description: A non-drying fatty alcohol that functions as an emollient and emulsifier.

ingredients.name: Propylene Glycol
ingredients.description: A humectant and solvent that can irritate sensitive skin.

ingredients.name: Polysorbate 20
ingredients.description: An emulsifier that may be contaminated with 1,4-dioxane, a potential carcinogen.

ingredients.name: Xanthan Gum
ingredients.description: A natural thickener and stabilizer derived from sugar fermentation.

ingredients.name: Carbomer
ingredients.description: A synthetic polymer used to create smooth gel textures. Considered safe.

ingredients.name: Phenoxyethanol
ingredients.description: A common preservative that can cause allergic reactions and skin irritation in some individuals.

ingredients.name: Potassium Sorbate
ingredients.description: A mild preservative often used in natural and food-grade products.

ingredients.name: Sodium Benzoate
ingredients.description: A preservative used in both food and cosmetics. Generally safe, but can be a slight irritant.

ingredients.name: Benzyl Alcohol
ingredients.description: A preservative and solvent that can be an allergen for some people.

ingredients.name: Tea Tree Oil
ingredients.description: An essential oil with antimicrobial properties, but can be a skin irritant for some.

ingredients.name: Panthenol
ingredients.description: A form of Vitamin B5 that is moisturizing and soothing.

ingredients.name: Aloe Vera
ingredients.description: A plant extract known for its soothing and anti-inflammatory properties.

ingredients.name: Vitamin C
ingredients.description: An antioxidant that can brighten skin, but may cause irritation in high concentrations or in sensitive skin. Generally considered safe.

ingredients.name: Ceramides
ingredients.description: Skin-identical lipids that help restore the skin's barrier. Very safe and beneficial.

ingredients.name: Zinc Oxide
ingredients.description: A mineral sunscreen filter that provides broad-spectrum UV protection. Considered very safe.

ingredients.name: Titanium Dioxide
ingredients.description: A mineral sunscreen filter and pigment. Safe for use on skin, especially in non-nano form.

ingredients.name: Squalane
ingredients.description: A lightweight, non-comedogenic emollient that mimics skin's natural oils.

ingredients.name: Dimethicone
ingredients.description: A silicone that provides a smooth texture and forms a protective barrier. Considered safe for cosmetic use.

ingredients.name: Sodium PCA
ingredients.description: A natural humectant that helps skin attract and retain moisture.

ingredients.name: Allantoin
ingredients.description: A soothing and healing ingredient that helps calm irritation.

ingredients.name: Witch Hazel
ingredients.description: A natural astringent that can be drying and irritating for some skin types, especially if it contains alcohol.

ingredients.name: Lactic Acid
ingredients.description: An alpha-hydroxy acid (AHA) for exfoliation. Can cause irritation and sun sensitivity if overused.

ingredients.name: Kaolin
ingredients.description: A gentle clay used in masks to absorb excess oil. Generally very safe.

ingredients.name: Salicylic Acid
ingredients.description: A beta-hydroxy acid (BHA) effective for acne, but can be drying and irritating.

ingredients.name: Isopropyl Alcohol
ingredients.description: A solvent that can be very drying and irritating to the skin, stripping its natural barrier.

ingredients.name: Tetrasodium EDTA
ingredients.description: A chelating agent that prevents minerals from binding together. Generally considered safe in cosmetics but can enhance the penetration of other ingredients.

ingredients.name: PEG-100 Stearate
ingredients.description: A polyethylene glycol ether of stearic acid. Concerns are related to potential contamination with 1,4-dioxane.

ingredients.name: Chlorphenesin
ingredients.description: A preservative that can cause skin irritation and contact dermatitis in some individuals.

ingredients.name: Silica
ingredients.description: A mineral used as an absorbent, anti-caking agent, and abrasive. Safe in its amorphous form in cosmetics.

ingredients.name: Ethylhexylglycerin
ingredients.description: A preservative and skin-conditioning agent. Can be a skin irritant for some.

ingredients.name: Prunus Amygdalus Dulcis Oil
ingredients.description: Sweet Almond Oil. A non-volatile, non-fragrant oil used as an emollient.

ingredients.name: Hydrogenated Styrene/Butadiene Copolymer
ingredients.description: A synthetic polymer used as a film-forming agent. Generally considered safe for use in cosmetics.

ingredients.name: Tocopheryl Acetate
ingredients.description: A form of Vitamin E, a natural skin-conditioning agent and antioxidant.

ingredients.name: Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil
ingredients.description: Sunflower Seed Oil. Used as an emollient and rich in nutrients like vitamin E.

ingredients.name: Citric Acid
ingredients.description: An alpha-hydroxy acid used to adjust the pH of products. Can have exfoliating properties in higher concentrations but is generally safe at low levels.

ingredients.name: Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone
ingredients.description: A synthetic fragrance ingredient. It is a known skin allergen and its use is restricted in the EU.

ingredients.name: Farnesol
ingredients.description: A fragrance ingredient that occurs naturally in some essential oils. It is a known allergen.

ingredients.name: Hydroxycitronellal
ingredients.description: A synthetic fragrance ingredient with a lily-of-the-valley scent. It is a common skin allergen.

ingredients.name: Linalool
ingredients.description: A naturally occurring fragrance compound found in many essential oils. Can cause allergic reactions when it oxidizes.

ingredients.name: Linalyl Acetate
ingredients.description: A synthetic fragrance compound, the main component of lavender and bergamot oils. Can be a skin sensitizer.

ingredients.name: Tetramethyl Acetyloctahydronaphthalenes
ingredients.description: A synthetic musk fragrance ingredient (e.g., Iso E Super). There are concerns about skin sensitization, allergic reactions, and potential environmental persistence.
